title: Autonomous busses
description: Climb aboard the future! This explainer takes viewers on a ride inside a real self-driving bus, mixing expert interviews, crisp narration, and playful animated segments to show how autonomous tech is steering us into tomorrow.

title: Apollo
description: A whirlwind one-minute script that unpacks Apollo’s cutting-edge Agentic AI: distilling dense tech into crisp, captivating storytelling. The challenge (and fun!) was translating a breakthrough in autonomous agents into something anyone can grasp—without losing the precision that makes it revolutionary.
display_credits:
Script: Michael Nirgad Guy
Directed & Produced: Liat Yoffe, SpaceCat

title: Fighting Fraud With Hybrid AI
description: From Kasparov vs. Deep Blue to today’s battle against online fraud—this three-minute explainer zips through the story of AI. It contrasts rule-based logic with learning systems, then shows how Forter cleverly blends both into a hybrid shield that keeps fraudsters in check.
display_credits:
Script: Michael Nirgad Guy
Directed & Produced: Liat Yoffe, SpaceCat

title: The Next Generation Of Video
description: Aliens crash the marketing party to deliver one message: stop blasting, start engaging! This playful animated video introduces Blings’ dynamic, interactive video platform.
display_credits:
Script: Michael Nirgad Guy
Produced: Laserbee

title: Accounting Musical
description: A musical journey into the future of finance: a straight-laced accountant is swept up by a dazzling, genie-like host who sings, dances, and whisks him through a whirlwind of change. The showy number turns spreadsheets into spectacle, inviting everyone to join the ride as accounting transforms before our eyes.
display_credits:
Co-written by Michael Nirgad Guy
Directed & produced by Tomer Gerbi, Nua motion

title: Quantum Computers Explained
description: What makes quantum computers so powerful—and so hard to build? Through expert voices and enlightening animated scenes, this explainer unpacks the strange rules of qubits and superposition to show how quantum machines might one day transform our world.

title: Microalgae Save The World
description: From toxic primordial Earth to today’s climate challenges, this cinematic script reimagines microalgae as the tiny superheroes of our planet. Blending planetary drama with playful touches like “five-star algae getaways,” the film turns science into spectacle—showing how these ancient organisms may hold the key to our future.
display_credits:
Script: Michael Nirgad Guy
Directed & Produced: Liat Yoffe, SpaceCat

title: Moments Of Light
description: Three tender stories from Jerusalem’s schools shine a spotlight on “moments of light.” A 5-year-old speaks about the kindergarten teacher who raised her—and her parents too. A teacher recalls a student who cared for his family during reserve duty. And a teen shares how a teacher became like family after her father passed away. Gentle illustrations bring each story to life with warmth and heart.

title: Heart of Jerusalem
description: From preschool giggles to teen wisdom, Jerusalem’s students and teachers answer “Who’s in your heart?” in a cascade of short, moving stories—set inside dreamy, animated 3D rooms. A warm, city-proud opener made to light up the Jerusalem education awards night.

title: Music of The Spheres
description: From Pythagoras and Plato to Kepler—and even Queen’s Brian May—thinkers have dreamed of cosmic music hidden in the heavens. This self-made passion project asks: can we actually hear the secret symphony of the solar system? Written, researched, edited, and even “badly animated in Paint” by yours truely

title: Conway’s Game of Life
description: Order from chaos, creatures from code—this homemade explainer dives into Conway’s legendary ‘Game of Life,’ where just two simple rules give rise to infinite complexity. With lo-fi Paint-style animation and genuine curiosity, it shows how beauty can emerge from the simplest math.
